BR_text.BRsummary: Predict function fails with multi modal task
BR_text.BRdescription:
<denchmark-h:h3>Bug Description</denchmark-h>
 
 If we train a model with a multi-modal approach, described in the documentation, we can't run predict on the model with the following error:
 ValueError: Failed to find data adapter that can handle input: (<class 'tuple'> containing values of types {"<class 'tensorflow.python.data.ops.dataset_ops.MapDataset'>"}), <class 'NoneType'>
 <denchmark-h:h3>Bug Reproduction</denchmark-h>
 
 Code for reproducing the bug:
 <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1aNDKe73yQElXUznjN0z99kx_GbBMOjRm?usp=sharing>https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1aNDKe73yQElXUznjN0z99kx_GbBMOjRm?usp=sharing</denchmark-link>
 
 This is the example given by autokeras, with a predict function added to the end showing the error.
 Data used by the code:
 Random numpy data
 <denchmark-h:h3>Setup Details</denchmark-h>
 
 Include the details about the versions of:
 
 OS type and version: Ubuntu 18.04. 3 LTS
 Python: 3.6.7
 autokeras: 1.0.10
 keras-tuner: 1.0.2rc3
 scikit-learn: 0.22.2.post1
 numpy: 1.18.5
 pandas: 1.1.2
 tensorflow: 2.3.0
 
 <denchmark-h:h3>Additional context</denchmark-h>
 
 If this is an easy bug to fix, if you can point out where I should be looking, I can open a PR.
 Further, if I'm doing something wrong in the example, let me know and I can also help correct some of the documentation in this area.
 Thanks so much!

comments_0.comment_text:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/haifeng-jin>@haifeng-jin</denchmark-link>
   I faced the same bug in v1.0.10 and just tested with the v1.0.11 that you released 5 days ago. However, I still hit into the issue. Can you confirm that it's in the bugfix for v1.0.11?
